explains: n. 不承诺，免责声明；放弃，拒绝

sentences.en: He added a disclaimer implying that Runge's letter didn't influence his work.
sentences.cn: 他补了一个免责声明，称朗格的信没有影响他的工作。

sentences.en: Advertisers sometimes offset or counterbalance an exaggerated claim with a disclaimer—a qualification or condition on the claim.
sentences.cn: "广告商有时会通过补偿或者免责的形式，即对索赔要求的一种限定或条件，来平衡夸大的说辞。

sentences.en: For example, the claim that breakfast cereal has a health benefit may be accompanied by the disclaimer "when part of a nutritionally balanced breakfast".
sentences.cn: 例如，宣称早餐麦片对健康有益的广告可能还会附带一个免责声明，即“当它是营养均衡早餐的一部分时”。
